rules: Rule1: If a paper was accepted by a journal, then provided that a project was funded by a grant, either data was analyzed using software or samples were collected in the field.
Rule2: Provided that a study was replicated in a lab, results were validated by a methodology.
Rule3: Provided that results were validated by a methodology, findings were confirmed through a review.
Rule4: If a model was developed by a researcher, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.
Rule5: Either a model was developed by a researcher, or a simulation was created by a team.
Rule6: Either a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, or an effect was measured with an instrument.
Rule7: Provided that a researcher published in a journal, a cure was discovered for a disease.
Rule8: If an effect was measured with an instrument, then samples were collected in the field.
Rule9: Whenever data was recorded by a sensor, data was analyzed using software.
Rule10: Provided that data was transmitted via a platform, data was recorded by a sensor.
Rule11: Either a tool was designed by an engineer, or a device was built by a technician.
Rule12: If a device was built by a technician, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.
Rule13: Whenever a device was approved by a regulator, a prototype was tested in a lab.
Rule14: If results were shared in a database, then provided that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.
Rule15: Provided that a researcher presented at a conference, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

Rule16: If a team collaborated with an institution, then given that a study was replicated in a lab, whenever a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

Rule17: Provided that researchers partnered with an organization, if a study was replicated in a lab, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.
Rule18: If a project was coordinated by a director, then a team collaborated with an institution.
Rule19: Either a project was coordinated by a director, or a team was managed by a leader.
Rule20: Provided that a team was managed by a leader, researchers partnered with an organization.
Rule21: If data was analyzed using software, then an invention was patented by an agency.
Rule22: Provided that samples were collected in the field, either a researcher published in a journal or a researcher presented at a conference.
Rule23: Whenever a paper was submitted to a journal, it was peer-reviewed by experts.
Rule24: Either a paper was submitted to a journal, or it was accepted by a journal.

Rule25: If it is not the case that whenever findings were confirmed through a review, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field, then a paper was retracted by a journal.

Rule26: If it is not the case that provided that a simulation was created by a team, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then a project was abandoned by an institution.

Rule27: If it is not the case that if a system was monitored by a satellite, then given that a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, data was transmitted via a platform, then a transmission failed over a network.

Rule28: If it is not the case that if a tool was designed by an engineer, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then a device was approved by a regulator.

Rule29: If it is not the case that provided that a tool was designed by an engineer, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then it is not the case that a prototype was tested in a lab.
Rule30: If results were not shared in a database, then access to data was restricted.
Rule31: If results were not shared in a database, then it is not the case that access to data was restricted.
facts: Fact1: A hypothesis was verified through an experiment.
Fact2: A study was replicated in a lab.
Fact3: A system was monitored by a satellite.
Fact4: A project was funded by a grant.
Fact5: It is not the case that a cure was discovered for a disease.
Fact6: It is not the case that a paper was retracted by a journal.
Fact7: It is not the case that a project was abandoned by an institution.
Fact8: It is not the case that a transmission failed over a network.
Fact9: It is not the case that an invention was patented by an agency.
Fact10: It is not the case that a paper was peer-reviewed by experts.

question: A breakthrough discovery occurred in a field.
